newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - GenRad stops moving down.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - GenRad stops moving down.

text.p: GenRad Inc shares broke their fall in after-hours trading on Monday, traders said, after the company lost almost a third of its value during regular trading hours.
GenRad closed at 12-3/4, down 5-1/2 on a day when it said first-quarter marketing expenses would be higher than expected. But the stock was not moving after hours, traders said.
First Call's consensus estimate for GenRad's full-year earnings per share is $1.25, a target the company said it still expects to achieve.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one volume was 1,300, compared to 33,400 on Friday. Session two volume was 10,015,421, while on Friday it was 2,396,100.
